sen.j: 保司（ほうし）とは日本の中世において国衙領の一種である保を管理する地方行政官である。
sen.e: Hoshi refers to officers of provincial government who administered ho, which was a type of Kokugaryo (territories governed by provincial government office) in medieval Japan.

sen.j: 保とは、荘園の小さなものと言う説もあるが、もともと天領のことで、私領を庄と言って区別していた。
sen.e: Although a theory has it that ho was a small-scaled shoen (manor), ho was originally a shogunal demesne which was distinguished from sho, which was private lands.

sen.j: 文治二年（１１８６年）閏七月二十二日（東鏡）源頼朝は平康頼を阿波国の天領麻植（おえ）保の保司に任命した。
sen.e: On September 14, 1186, according to Azumakagami (chronology about Kamakura-bakufu), MINAMOTO no Yoritomo appointed TAIRA no Yasuyori as hoshi of Oe-no-ho, a shogunal demesne in Province of Awa.

On September 14, 1186, according to Azumakagami (The chronology of the Kamakura bakufu [Japanese feudal government headed by a shogun]), MINAMOTO no Yoritomo appointed TAIRA no Yasuyori as hoshi of Oe no ho, a shogunal demesne in the Province of Awa.

sen.j: 従って、麻植保から上がる年貢は、宮中にある内蔵寮へ納める事になっている。
sen.e: Therefore nengu (land tax) collected from Oe-no-ho was customarily deposited to Kuraryo (Bureau of Palace Storehouses) of the Imperial Court.
